channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Brand Visibility in Packaging: A Deep Learning Approach for Logo Detection, Saliency-Map Prediction, and Logo Placement Analysis
item.description: In the third step, by integrating logo detection with a saliency map generation, the framework provides a comprehensive brand attention score.

item.title: CrackNex: a Few-shot Low-light Crack Segmentation Model Based on Retinex Theory for UAV Inspections
item.description: LCSD consists of 102 well-illuminated crack images and 41 low-light crack images.

item.title: Federated Learning Under Attack: Exposing Vulnerabilities through Data Poisoning Attacks in Computer Networks
item.description: In LF, we randomly flipped the labels of benign data and trained the model on the manipulated data.

item.title: KnowAgent: Knowledge-Augmented Planning for LLM-Based Agents
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated great potential in complex reasoning tasks, yet they fall short when tackling more sophisticated challenges, especially when interacting with environments through generating executable actions.

item.title: Feast Your Eyes: Mixture-of-Resolution Adaptation for Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Contrary to previous works, we study this problem from the perspective of image resolution, and reveal that a combination of low- and high-resolution visual features can effectively mitigate this shortcoming.

item.title: Why Not Use Your Textbook? Knowledge-Enhanced Procedure Planning of Instructional Videos
item.description: This knowledge, sourced from training procedure plans and structured as a directed weighted graph, equips the agent to better navigate the complexities of step sequencing and its potential variations.

item.title: Dirichlet-based Per-Sample Weighting by Transition Matrix for Noisy Label Learning
item.description: We propose good utilization of the transition matrix is crucial and suggest a new utilization method based on resampling, coined RENT.

item.title: DNNLasso: Scalable Graph Learning for Matrix-Variate Data
item.description: We consider the problem of jointly learning row-wise and column-wise dependencies of matrix-variate observations, which are modelled separately by two precision matrices.

item.title: What do we learn from inverting CLIP models?
item.description: We employ an inversion-based approach to examine CLIP models.

item.title: Dual Mean-Teacher: An Unbiased Semi-Supervised Framework for Audio-Visual Source Localization
item.description: Audio-Visual Source Localization (AVSL) aims to locate sounding objects within video frames given the paired audio clips.

item.title: Towards General Computer Control: A Multimodal Agent for Red Dead Redemption II as a Case Study
item.description: Recent studies have demonstrated the success of foundation agents in specific tasks or scenarios.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning Approaches for Identifying ICU Patient Subgroups: Do Results Generalise?
item.description: However, it is unclear whether common patient subgroups exist across different ICUs, which would determine whether ICU restructuring could be operationalised in a standardised manner.

item.title: Behavior Generation with Latent Actions
item.description: Unlike language or image generation, decision making requires modeling actions - continuous-valued vectors that are multimodal in their distribution, potentially drawn from uncurated sources, where generation errors can compound in sequential prediction.

item.title: Active Statistical Inference
item.description: This means that for the same number of collected samples, active inference enables smaller confidence intervals and more powerful p-values.

item.title: Learning to Defer to a Population: A Meta-Learning Approach
item.description: The learning to defer (L2D) framework allows autonomous systems to be safe and robust by allocating difficult decisions to a human expert.

item.title: DPPA: Pruning Method for Large Language Model to Model Merging
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a dual-stage method termed Dynamic Pruning Partition Amplification (DPPA), devised to tackle the challenge of merging complex fine-tuned models.

item.title: From Spectra to Biophysical Insights: End-to-End Learning with a Biased Radiative Transfer Model
item.description: Advances in machine learning have boosted the use of Earth observation data for climate change research.

item.title: Enhancing Weakly Supervised 3D Medical Image Segmentation through Probabilistic-aware Learning
item.description: 3D medical image segmentation is a challenging task with crucial implications for disease diagnosis and treatment planning.

item.title: TESTAM: A Time-Enhanced Spatio-Temporal Attention Model with Mixture of Experts
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel deep learning model named TESTAM, which individually models recurring and non-recurring traffic patterns by a mixture-of-experts model with three experts on temporal modeling, spatio-temporal modeling with static graph, and dynamic spatio-temporal dependency modeling with dynamic graph.

item.title: MADTP: Multimodal Alignment-Guided Dynamic Token Pruning for Accelerating Vision-Language Transformer
item.description: To this end, we propose a novel framework named Multimodal Alignment-Guided Dynamic Token Pruning (MADTP) for accelerating various VLTs.

item.title: Linear quadratic control of nonlinear systems with Koopman operator learning and the Nystr√∂m method
item.description: In this paper, we study how the Koopman operator framework can be combined with kernel methods to effectively control nonlinear dynamical systems.

item.title: Remove that Square Root: A New Efficient Scale-Invariant Version of AdaGrad
item.description: Adaptive methods are extremely popular in machine learning as they make learning rate tuning less expensive.

item.title: Android in the Zoo: Chain-of-Action-Thought for GUI Agents
item.description: To address this, this work presents Chain-of-Action-Thought (dubbed CoAT), which takes the description of the previous actions, the current screen, and more importantly the action thinking of what actions should be performed and the outcomes led by the chosen action.

item.title: PromptKD: Unsupervised Prompt Distillation for Vision-Language Models
item.description: To our best knowledge, we are the first to (1) perform unsupervised domain-specific prompt-driven knowledge distillation for CLIP, and (2) establish a practical pre-storing mechanism of text features as shared class vectors between teacher and student.

item.title: Uplift Modeling for Target User Attacks on Recommender Systems
item.description: UBA estimates the treatment effect on each target user and optimizes the allocation of fake user budgets to maximize the attack performance.

item.title: SGD with Partial Hessian for Deep Neural Networks Optimization
item.description: Compared with first-order optimizers, it adopts a certain amount of information from the Hessian matrix to assist optimization, while compared with the existing second-order optimizers, it keeps the good generalization performance of first-order optimizers.

item.title: Recall-Oriented Continual Learning with Generative Adversarial Meta-Model
item.description: The stability-plasticity dilemma is a major challenge in continual learning, as it involves balancing the conflicting objectives of maintaining performance on previous tasks while learning new tasks.

item.title: PARADISE: Evaluating Implicit Planning Skills of Language Models with Procedural Warnings and Tips Dataset
item.description: Recently, there has been growing interest within the community regarding whether large language models are capable of planning or executing plans.

item.title: Evolution Transformer: In-Context Evolutionary Optimization
item.description: Given a trajectory of evaluations and search distribution statistics, Evolution Transformer outputs a performance-improving update to the search distribution.

item.title: FedHCDR: Federated Cross-Domain Recommendation with Hypergraph Signal Decoupling
item.description: Specifically, to address the data heterogeneity across domains, we introduce an approach called hypergraph signal decoupling (HSD) to decouple the user features into domain-exclusive and domain-shared features.

item.title: Preventing Reward Hacking with Occupancy Measure Regularization
item.description: Thus, we propose regularizing based on the OM divergence between policies instead of AD divergence to prevent reward hacking.

item.title: On the Asymptotic Mean Square Error Optimality of Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs) have recently shown great potential for denoising tasks.

item.title: Towards Democratized Flood Risk Management: An Advanced AI Assistant Enabled by GPT-4 for Enhanced Interpretability and Public Engagement
item.description: This AI Assistant is designed to facilitate effective communication between decision-makers, the general public, and flood forecasters, without the requirement of specialized knowledge.

item.title: TaylorShift: Shifting the Complexity of Self-Attention from Squared to Linear (and Back) using Taylor-Softmax
item.description: The quadratic complexity of the attention mechanism represents one of the biggest hurdles for processing long sequences using Transformers.

item.title: Revisiting Confidence Estimation: Towards Reliable Failure Prediction
item.description: Reliable confidence estimation is a challenging yet fundamental requirement in many risk-sensitive applications.

item.title: Causal Walk: Debiasing Multi-Hop Fact Verification with Front-Door Adjustment
item.description: Conventional multi-hop fact verification models are prone to rely on spurious correlations from the annotation artifacts, leading to an obvious performance decline on unbiased datasets.

item.title: FinReport: Explainable Stock Earnings Forecasting via News Factor Analyzing Model
item.description: However, compared with financial institutions, it is not easy for ordinary investors to mine factors and analyze news.

item.title: SimuCourt: Building Judicial Decision-Making Agents with Real-world Judgement Documents
item.description: In this paper, (1) we introduce SimuCourt, a judicial benchmark that encompasses 420 judgment documents from real-world, spanning the three most common types of judicial cases, and a novel task Judicial Decision-Making to evaluate the judicial analysis and decision-making power of agents.

item.title: Updating the Minimum Information about CLinical Artificial Intelligence (MI-CLAIM) checklist for generative modeling research
item.description: In response to gaps in standards and best practices for the development of clinical AI tools identified by US Executive Order 141103 and several emerging national networks for clinical AI evaluation, we begin to formalize some of these guidelines by building on the "Minimum information about clinical artificial intelligence modeling" (MI-CLAIM) checklist.

item.title: FLGuard: Byzantine-Robust Federated Learning via Ensemble of Contrastive Models
item.description: However, recent research proposed poisoning attacks that cause a catastrophic loss in the accuracy of the global model when adversaries, posed as benign clients, are present in a group of clients.

item.title: Differentially Private Synthetic Data via Foundation Model APIs 2: Text
item.description: Lin et al. (2024) recently introduced the Private Evolution (PE) algorithm to generate DP synthetic images with only API access to diffusion models.

item.title: adaptMLLM: Fine-Tuning Multilingual Language Models on Low-Resource Languages with Integrated LLM Playgrounds
item.description: As a multilingual tool, we used adaptMLLM to fine-tune models for two low-resource language pairs: English to Irish (EN$\leftrightarrow$GA) and English to Marathi (EN$\leftrightarrow$MR).

item.title: Masked Thought: Simply Masking Partial Reasoning Steps Can Improve Mathematical Reasoning Learning of Language Models
item.description: In reasoning tasks, even a minor error can cascade into inaccurate results, leading to suboptimal performance of large language models in such domains.

item.title: NiNformer: A Network in Network Transformer with Token Mixing Generated Gating Function
item.description: The Attention Mechanism was utilized in Computer Vision as the Vision Transformer ViT, and its usage has expanded into many tasks in the vision domain, such as classification, segmentation, object detection, and image generation.

item.title: COLA: Cross-city Mobility Transformer for Human Trajectory Simulation
item.description: To address these challenges, we have tailored a Cross-city mObiLity trAnsformer (COLA) with a dedicated model-agnostic transfer framework by effectively transferring cross-city knowledge for human trajectory simulation.

item.title: HyperPredict: Estimating Hyperparameter Effects for Instance-Specific Regularization in Deformable Image Registration
item.description: Our approach which we call HyperPredict, implements a Multi-Layer Perceptron that learns the effect of selecting particular hyperparameters for registering an image pair by predicting the resulting segmentation overlap and measure of deformation smoothness.

item.title: Rethinking LLM Language Adaptation: A Case Study on Chinese Mixtral
item.description: Mixtral, a representative sparse mixture of experts (SMoE) language model, has received significant attention due to its unique model design and superior performance.

item.title: Scalable Vision-Based 3D Object Detection and Monocular Depth Estimation for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Collectively, these contributions lay a robust foundation for the widespread adoption of vision-based 3D perception technologies in autonomous driving applications.

item.title: Applied Causal Inference Powered by ML and AI
item.description: An introduction to the emerging fusion of machine learning and causal inference.

item.title: Diffusion-TS: Interpretable Diffusion for General Time Series Generation
item.description: Denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs) are becoming the leading paradigm for generative models.
